title: Record Git Revision + diffs when building
body:
1. When building a pkg, record the git revision (and any uncommitted changes) of the source code that was built.
2. When running, copy that revision info from the pkg/ directory to the run directory (in case the pkg/ directory is later purged).

The following should do the trick:

```
[rpfische@gs611-gibbs modelE]$ git rev-parse HEAD
4f4513c4d050ed061b8d2b5a091a4a00f05f3cc6
[rpfische@gs611-gibbs modelE]$ git diff
[rpfische@gs611-gibbs modelE]$ 
```

Or better yet.... grep off the first few lines of `git log`:

```
commit 4f4513c4d050ed061b8d2b5a091a4a00f05f3cc6
Author: Elizabeth Fischer <elizabeth.fischer@columbia.edu>
Date:   Sat Aug 13 00:52:00 2016 -0400

    Write human-readable timestamp every timestep
```

Should also include information from `git info`:

```
== Remote URL: origin   simplex.giss.nasa.gov:/giss/gitrepo/modelE.git (fetch)
```
